It's regarded as a wakizashi????That means the kodachi is a sword.
 
Edy


Richardson Paul <umaryu@...> wrote:Hi

what explaination would you like. I have studied
Kukishinden Ryu Kodachi and been shown Hon Tai Yoshin
Ryu Kodachi.


Paul


--- andrea Smith <andjoysmith@...> wrote:


---------------------------------
Ah, thank you. I'd like to get the explantion of the
Ryu of the kodachi. *slaps self*

Richardson Paul <umaryu@...> wrote:Hi

in some cases the kodachi is also regarded as a
wakizashi.

Several Ryu still teach the use of the kodachi, two I
can name are Kukishinden Ryu (3 kata) and HonTai
Yoshin Ryu (5 kata and I think some ura gata).

paul


--- andjoysmith <andjoysmith@...> wrote:


---------------------------------
Okay, I know this is a very studid, but I was
wondering about the 
kodachi and what it was used for. Really help me out.
What is the 
kodachi used for? Slap me if you like, please!
